candidates.name: Greg Brownless
candidates.why_elect: The advantage I have is my connectedness to the community. I'm involved at all levels and most days and nights I'm out visiting organisations and events. I've been successful in business and I've given back. With proven community service and commitment, I lead by example.
candidates.why_stand: I've lived and been active here for 33 years. Community, temperate climate and wonderful beaches make it the best place to live. I established a successful business here and then established a charitable trust to give back. I know the people and want to represent their best interests.

candidates.affiliation: Let's Build a Better City.  Together.
candidates.name: Kelvin Clout
candidates.why_elect: I have faithfully served as Deputy Mayor under two mayors and am ready to take on the top job. Nothing beats the experience and energy I will bring to the Mayoralty. I am a champion and advocate for Tauranga, and will work collaboratively with councillors and our beloved community.
candidates.why_stand: I love Tauranga and believe I already make an excellent contribution to our city's governance. I want to help Tauranga achieve it's amazing potential and be a 'magnet city' to the world's best talent. I want my mokopuna to study, and build a career or business, in this beautiful rohe.

candidates.affiliation: Your choice for your voice - Stop the waste
candidates.name: Murray Guy

candidates.affiliation: Fix the Council, vote for positive change
candidates.name: Andrew Hollis
candidates.why_elect: I have enormous experience working with diverse cultures across the world including every continent bringing people together to get the job done. Finance, systemising huge complex datasets and bringing teams together is what I do and have done for decades. I'm looking forward to helping to bring us together.
candidates.why_stand: I believe voters need a choice that isn't a councillor, previous councillor or an new comer with only a passing interest in Tauranga. I offer a skilled team player with international finance and infrastructure and management experience covering multiple cultures. I have also worked closely with 100s of small businesses.

candidates.name: RangiMarie TeAmopiu-Kaa Kingi
candidates.why_elect: What I have decided is that this is another dirty white society survey by the same stake cronies who keep these dictators in office. I would like a copy of this survey and all details of who the mind games questionnaires are. It's the season of Claims, British False Claims.
candidates.why_stand: To use it as a platform to enforce Māori Lore of The Land and Justice system under King Tawhiao's Declaration of Independence 1835 to the present. A Māori Government to identify British false claims of ownership to Tauranga and NZ. As a Māori woman for the Mayoral role. Because Tauranga is dying.

candidates.name: Jos Nagels
candidates.why_elect: I have a knowledge, experience, foresight, innovative ability, diplomacy and desire to set the future direction so Tauranga can be an example for other regions. I have been resident in Tauranga for 42 years.
candidates.why_stand: I have an overall vision for the city and its environs to lead into the next 50 years and avoid repeat of past mistakes of other cities.

candidates.name: Tenby Powell
candidates.why_elect: I have considerable senior leadership experience at CEO, board director and chairman level spanning the private business sector, government entities, not-for-profit and the military. I am a compassionate leader and team builder who seeks to transform TCC into a responsive, efficient and trusted organization which serves Tauranga city.
candidates.why_stand: I am hard wired to make a difference. It has driven much of what I've done in life, from military service, charitable boards for service organizations, fifteen years advocacy for small business owners. I believe Tauranga deserves better leadership and I can deliver that for the future of our city.

candidates.name: Les Wallen
candidates.why_elect: As a Pastor, I care about people and I care about what affects you. I am a businessman and know how to make one dollar do the work of two. I don't waste money and will consider all information being presented by staff before acting on it.
candidates.why_stand: Tauranga is my home city, where I grew up upon leaving school. When I look at the city now, I see a broken, clogged city with very little additional infrastructure compared to what was here when I left in 1971. I am well experienced at fixing broken things.
